text: The United States Census of 1880 was the tenth United States Census. It was done by the Census Bureau during June 1880.1880 Census: Instructions to Enumerators from IPUMS, a website of the Minnesota Population Center at the University of Minnesota It was the first time that women were allowed to be enumerators.From Inkwell To Internet: 1880 from the U.S. Census Bureau The Superintendent of the Census was Francis Amasa Walker. The 1880 census found the population of the United States to be 50,189,209. This was an increase of 30.2 percent from the 1870 Census.Resident Population of the United States from a State of Wyoming website ==References== Category:1880 in the United States Category:United States Census
title: 1880 United States Census
